headline: EA Stock Hits Record High On Buzz For New Video Game
summary: Electronic Arts is riding high on excitement for "Battlefield 6," the latest in its combat action video game series. EA stock notched a record high.

headline: Saudi Arabia Online Gaming Market Growth and Competitive Analysis Report 2025-2033 Featuring Activision Blizzard, Apple, Capcom, Electronic Arts, Microsoft, Nintendo, Sony, Tencent
summary: The Saudi Arabia Online Gaming Market is poised for robust expansion, expected to grow from US$ 1.77 million in 2024 to US$ 4.44 million by 2033, at a CAGR of 10.77%. Key growth drivers include increased internet penetration, youth demographics, and government initiatives under Vision 2030 focused on gaming and esports. headline: Madden NFL 26 Championship Series Competitions Return to Full Sail University Orlando Health Fortress for Second Consecutive Year
summary: EA Esports and Full Sail University are proud to announce the return of the Madden NFL 26 Championship Series (MCS 26) to the Full Sail University Orlando Health Fortress for the second consecutive year. Following the overwhelming success of last year's events, four select MCS 26 competitions and broadcast productions, beginning in September 2025 through January 2026, will be held on Full Sail's Winter Park, Florida campus just minutes from EA's offices in Orlando, Florida.

headline: Electronic Arts (EA) Q2 CY2025 Deep Dive: Sports Franchises Drive Engagement, But Margin Pressures Persist
summary: Video game publisher Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) reported Q2 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, but sales were flat year on year at $1.67 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $1.8 billion was less impressive, coming in 5.9% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $0.79 per share was 25.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Electronic Arts’s Q2 Earnings Call
summary: Electronic Arts’ second quarter results were met with a positive market reaction, with revenue and profit both surpassing Wall Street expectations. Management credited the performance to deepening engagement across its core sports franchises, notably Global Football (FC), Madden NFL, and the continued momentum of Apex Legends.
